tool.name: View
tool.description: View Reformat, filter, or subsample alignments in SAM/BAM/CRAM format

xml.name: flagopts
xml.option: template having multiple segments in sequencing (1)
each segment properly aligned according to the aligner (2)
next segment in the template unmapped (8)
SEQ of the next segment in the template being reverse complemented (32)
the first segment in the template (64)
the last segment in the template (128)
not passing filters, such as platform/vendor quality controls (512)

tool.command:
samtools view -@ \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-1}
## output type options #if $cond_outtype.outtype == 'bam' -b $cond_outtype.bamtype else if $cond_outtype.outtype == 'cram' -C #end if
## filter options (regions filter is the last parameter) #if $cond_filter.select_filter == 'yes' #if str( $cond_filter.bedfile ) != 'None' -L '$cond_filter.bedfile' #end if #if str( $cond_filter.readgr ) != '' -r '$cond_filter.readgr' #end if #if str ( $cond_filter.rgfile ) != 'None' -R '$cond_filter.rgfile' #end if #if int( $cond_filter.quality ) > 0 -q $cond_filter.quality #end if #if str( $cond_filter.library ) != '' -l '$cond_filter.library' #end if #if str( $cond_filter.cigarcons ) != '' -m $cond_filter.cigarcons #end if #if $cond_filter.bits != "None" ## TODO is calculation like so OK? -f `echo $cond_filter.bits | sed 's/,/+/g' | bc` #end if #if $cond_filter.bitsneg != "None" -F `echo $cond_filter.bitsneg | sed 's/,/+/g' | bc` #end if #for $i, $s in enumerate($cond_filter.readtags) -x '${s.readtag}' #end for #end if #if $cond_subsample.select_subsample == 'yes' -s $cond_subsample.seed\.$cond_subsample.subsample #end if
## output options $adv_output.header $adv_output.headeronly $adv_output.count $adv_output.collapsecigar #if $adv_output.outputpassing == 'yes' -U inv_sam #end if -o sam
## additional reference data #if $cond_addrefs.select_addrefs == 'yes' #if str( $cond_addrefs.fastaref ) != 'None' -T $cond_addrefs.fastaref #end if #if str( $cond_addrefs.refsize ) != 'None' -t $cond_addrefs.refsize #end if #end if
$samfile
## region filter need to be at the end #if $cond_filter.select_filter == 'yes' and str( $cond_filter.regions ) != '' '$cond_filter.regions' #end if

param.name: outtype
param.label: Output type
param.option: CRAM (-C) - requires to provide reference size data set

param.name: regions
param.label: Filter by regions
param.help: Specify one or more space-separated region specifications to restrict output to only those alignments which overlap the specified region(s).

param.name: bedfile
param.label: Filter by intervals in a bed file
param.help: Only output alignments overlapping the intervals in the input bed file. (-L)

param.name: readgr
param.label: Filter by read group
param.help: Only output alignments in read group. (-r)

param.name: rgfile
param.label: Filter by read groups in file
param.help: Output alignments in read groups listed in FILE. (-R)

param.name: quality
param.label: Filter by quality
param.help: Skip alignments with MAPQ smaller than INT. (-q)

param.name: library
param.label: Filter by library
param.help: Only output alignments in library STR (-l)

param.name: cigarcons
param.label: Filter by number of CIGAR bases consuming query sequence
param.help: Only output alignments with number of CIGAR bases consuming query sequence greater than or equal INT. (-m)

param.name: bits
param.label: Filter by flags
param.help: Only output alignments with the following bits set in the FLAG field. (-f)

param.name: bitsneg
param.label: Inverse filter by flags
param.help: Do not output alignments with the following bits set in the FLAG field. (-F)

param.name: readtag
param.label: Filter by read tag
param.help: Read tag to exclude from output. (-x)

param.name: subsample
param.label: Subsampling fraction
param.help: sets the fraction of templates/pairs to subsample. (-s)

param.name: select_addrefs
param.label: Provide additional reference data
param.help: (-t/-T). One of these two options is required when SAM input does not contain @SQ headers, and the -T option is required whenever writing CRAM output.

param.name: fastaref
param.label: FASTA format reference FILE
param.help: FASTA format reference FILE, optionally compressed by bgzip and ideally indexed by samtools faidx. If an index is not present, one will be generated for you. (-T)

param.name: refsize
param.label: Reference sizes
param.help: A tabular dataset. Each line must contain the reference name in the first column and the length of the reference in the second column, with one line for each distinct reference. Any additional fields beyond the second column are ignored. This file also defines the order of the reference sequences in sorting. If you run: `samtools faidx ref.fa', the resulting index file ref.fa.fai can be used as this FILE. (-t)

param.name: header
param.label: Include the header in the output

param.name: count
param.label: Return count of alignments only.
param.help: Instead of printing the alignments, only count them and print the total number. All filters, ie. bits (-f/-F) and map quality (-q) are taken into account (-c)

param.name: outputpassing
param.label: Output alignments not passing the filter
param.help: Write alignments that are not selected by the various filter options to an extra data set. When this option is used, all alignments (or all alignments intersecting the regions specified) are written to either the output data set or this extra output data set, but never both. (-U)

tool.help:
**What it does**
With no options or regions specified, prints all alignments in the specified input alignment file (in SAM, BAM, or CRAM format) to standard output in SAM format (with no header).
You may specify one or more space-separated region specifications after the input filename to restrict output to only those alignments which overlap the specified region(s). Use of region specifications requires a coordinate-sorted and indexed input file (in BAM or CRAM format).
Regions can be specified as: RNAME[:STARTPOS[-ENDPOS]] and all position coordinates are 1-based.
Important note: when multiple regions are given, some alignments may be output multiple times if they overlap more than one of the specified regions.
Examples of region specifications:
- chr1 Output all alignments mapped to the reference sequence named 'chr1' (i.e. @SQ SN:chr1). - chr2:1000000 The region on chr2 beginning at base position 1,000,000 and ending at the end of the chromosome. - chr3:1000-2000 The 1001bp region on chr3 beginning at base position 1,000 and ending at base position 2,000 (including both end positions). - '*' Output the unmapped reads at the end of the file. (This does not include any unmapped reads placed on a reference sequence alongside their mapped mates.) - . Output all alignments. (Mostly unnecessary as not specifying a region at all has the same effect.)
The -b, -C, -1, -u, -h, -H, and -c options change the output format from the default of headerless SAM, and the -o and -U options set the output file name(s).
The -t and -T options provide additional reference data. One of these two options is required when SAM input does not contain @SQ headers, and the -T option is required whenever writing CRAM output.
The -L, -r, -R, -q, -l, -m, -f, and -F options filter the alignments that will be included in the output to only those alignments that match certain criteria.
The -x, -B, and -s options modify the data which is contained in each alignment.
Finally, the -@ option can be used to allocate additional threads to be used for compression, and the -? option requests a long help message.
